cards.name: Abundance
cards.text: If you would draw a card, you may instead choose land or nonland and reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a card of the chosen kind. Put that card into your hand and put all other cards revealed this way on the bottom of your library in any order.
cards.originalText: Instead of drawing a card, you may choose land or nonland and reveal cards from your library until you reveal a card of the chosen kind. Put that card into your hand and put all other revealed cards on the bottom of your library in any order.

rulings.text: This replacement effect replaces the draw, so nothing that triggers on a draw will trigger.

If you use this on a multi-card draw, each replaced draw is handled separately. In other words, you reveal and then put on the bottom of the library for the first card, then do the same for the second, and so on. In a multi-card draw you do not have to choose how many of those draws will be replaced before you do any drawing or use of this card.
If no card of the chosen type is found before your library empties, you don't get a card, but you do get to order all the cards in your library any way you choose.

If your library is empty, Abundance can prevent you from losing the game for being unable to draw a card. If an effect or turn-based action would cause you to draw a card, you can replace that draw with Abundance's replacement effect. (It doesn't matter that you'd be unable to actually draw a card.) Since Abundance's effect has you put a card into your hand instead of drawing a card, you'll never be forced to draw a card with an empty library.

cards.name: Chimeric Staff
cards.text: {X}: Chimeric Staff becomes an X/X Construct artifact creature until end of turn.
cards.originalText: {X} Chimeric Staff is an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to X until end of turn.
cards.flavor: A snake in the grasp.

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

If Chimeric Staff is already an artifact creature when you activate its ability, Chimeric Staff stays an artifact creature but the ability resets its creature types. You always apply the effect from this card before counters or other effects that modify power and toughness. For example, if you pay {3} to make it a 3/3, then someone gives it -1/-1, it will be a 2/2. If you then activate the ability with {4}, you will apply the "4/4" effect before the -1/-1 effect, so the end result will be a 3/3. Damage that was dealt to the creature stays on it.

The amount of damage dealt to a creature is not bounded by its toughness, and the amount of damage dealt to a player is not bounded by that player's life total. For example, if Corrupt deals 6 damage to a 2/2 creature, you'll gain 6 life.
Corrupt counts any land you control with the subtype Swamp, not just ones named Swamp.

printings: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition

cards.name: Darkest Hour
cards.text: All creatures are black.
cards.originalText: All creatures are black.
cards.flavor:
"Yawgmoth spent eons wrapping Phyrexians in human skin. They are the sleeper agents, and they are everywhere."

—Xantcha, to Urza

rulings.text: Affected creatures lose all other colors and are mono-black.

cards.name: Defensive Formation
cards.text: Rather than the attacking player, you assign the combat damage of each creature attacking you. You can divide that creature's combat damage as you choose among any of the creatures blocking it.
cards.originalText: Instead of the attacking player, you choose how creatures attacking you deal combat damage.
cards.flavor:
"Your enemies will pound upon the door of your defenses, but only you shall have the key, and it is the key of life."

—Song of All, canto 873

rulings.text: Damage assignment choices from Trample and other things which allow alternative damage assignments for attacking creatures are all made by you.
With the exception of ignoring the damage assignment order, you follow all the normal rules for damage assignment.

cards.name: Despondency
cards.text:
Enchant creature

Enchanted creature gets -2/-0.

When Despondency is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, return Despondency to its owner's hand.
cards.originalText:
Enchanted creature gets -2/-0.

When Despondency is put into a graveyard from play, return Despondency to owner's hand.

cards.name: Destructive Urge
cards.text:
Enchant creature

Whenever enchanted creature deals combat damage to a player, that player sacrifices a land.
cards.originalText: Whenever enchanted creature successfully deals combat damage to a player, that player sacrifices a land.
cards.flavor: Red sky at night, dragon's delight.

rulings.text: The ability has no effect if the player has no lands.

cards.name: Diabolic Servitude
cards.text:
When Diabolic Servitude enters the battlefield, return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.

When the creature put onto the battlefield with Diabolic Servitude dies, exile it and return Diabolic Servitude to its owner's hand.

When Diabolic Servitude leaves the battlefield, exile the creature put onto the battlefield with Diabolic Servitude.
cards.originalText:
When Diabolic Servitude comes into play, choose target creature card in your graveyard and put that creature into play. 

When the chosen creature is put into a graveyard, remove the creature from the game and return Diabolic Servitude to owner's hand.

When Diabolic Servitude leaves play, remove the chosen creature from the game.

rulings.text: If the creature is on the battlefield and is returned to its owner's hand or is exiled, this card loses track of the creature and has no further effects in the future.

cards.name: Disciple of Grace
cards.text:
Protection from black

Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
cards.originalText:
Protection from black

Cycling {2} (You may pay {2} and discard this card from your hand to draw a card. Play this ability as an instant.)
cards.flavor: Beauty is beyond law.

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

cards.name: Disciple of Law
cards.text:
Protection from red

Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
cards.originalText:
Protection from red

Cycling {2} (You may pay {2} and discard this card from your hand to draw a card. Play this ability as an instant.)
cards.flavor: A religious order for religious order.

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

cards.name: Discordant Dirge
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a verse counter on Discordant Dirge.

{B}, Sacrifice Discordant Dirge: Look at target opponent's hand and choose up to X cards from it, where X is the number of verse counters on Discordant Dirge. That player discards those cards.
cards.originalText:
During your upkeep, you may put a verse counter on Discordant Dirge.

{B}, Sacrifice Discordant Dirge: Look at target opponent's hand and choose up to X of those cards, where X is the number of verse counters on Discordant Dirge. That player discards those cards.

rulings.text: Adding a counter is optional. If you forget to add one during your upkeep, you cannot back up and add one later.

cards.name: Disenchant
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
cards.originalText: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
cards.flavor:
"Let Phyrexia breed evil in the darkness; my holy light will reveal its taint."

—Serra

rulings.text: This is not modal. If the target changes from an artifact to an enchantment or vice versa, this still destroys it.

cards.name: Disorder
cards.text: Disorder deals 2 damage to each white creature and each player who controls a white creature.
cards.originalText: Disorder deals 2 damage to each white creature and each player who controls a white creature.
cards.flavor:
"Then, just when the other guys were winnin', the sky threw up."

—Jula, goblin raider

rulings.text: Players take 0 or 2 damage. Disorder does not do 2 damage per creature to the player.

cards.name: Disruptive Student
cards.text: {T}: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1}.
cards.originalText: {T}: Counter target spell unless its caster pays an additional {1}. Play this ability as an interrupt.
cards.flavor:
"Teferi is a problem student. Always late for class. No appreciation for constructive use of time."

—Barrin, progress report

cards.name: Douse
cards.text: {1}{U}: Counter target red spell.
cards.originalText: {1}{U} Counter target red spell. Play this ability as an interrupt.
cards.flavor: The academy's libraries were protected by fire-prevention spells. Even after the disaster, the books were intact—though forever sealed in time.

cards.name: Dragon Blood
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
cards.originalText: {3}, {T}: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
cards.flavor: Fire in the blood, fire in the belly.

cards.text:
Flying

At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Drifting Djinn unless you pay {1}{U}.

Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
cards.originalText:
Flying

During your upkeep, pay {1}{U} or sacrifice Drifting Djinn.

Cycling {2} (You may pay {2} and discard this card from your hand to draw a card. Play this ability as an instant.)

rulings.text: You choose whether to pay or not on resolution. If not, then you sacrifice Drifting Djinn. You can choose to not pay if you no longer control this card on resolution.

Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

cards.name: Drifting Meadow
cards.text:
Drifting Meadow enters the battlefield tapped.

{T}: Add {W} to your mana pool.

Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
cards.originalText:

{T}: Add {W} to your mana pool.

Cycling {2} (You may pay {2} and discard this card from your hand to draw a card. Play this ability as an instant.)

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

cards.name: Dromosaur
cards.text: Whenever Dromosaur blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +2/-2 until end of turn.
cards.originalText: Whenever Dromosaur blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +2/-2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: They say dromosaurs are frightened of dogs, even little ones. There are no dogs in Shiv. Not even little ones.

rulings.text: If it manages to block or become blocked more than once in a turn, it can get the bonus twice.
Switching blockers will not re-trigger this since it only triggers on becoming blocked and switching does not unblock and reblock it.

cards.name: Duress
cards.text: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a noncreature, nonland card from it. That player discards that card.
cards.originalText: Look at target opponent's hand and choose a noncreature, nonland card there. That player discards that card.
cards.flavor:
"We decide who is worthy of our works."

—Gix, Yawgmoth praetor

cards.name: Eastern Paladin
cards.text: {B}{B}, {T}: Destroy target green creature.
cards.originalText: {B}{B}, {T}: Destroy target green creature.
cards.flavor:
"Their fragile world. Their futile lives. They obstruct the Grand Evolution. In Yawgmoth's name, we shall excise them."

—Oath of the East

cards.name: Electryte
cards.text: Whenever Electryte deals combat damage to defending player, it deals damage equal to its power to each blocking creature.
cards.originalText: Whenever Electryte successfully deals combat damage to defending player, Electryte deals damage equal to its power to each blocking creature.
cards.flavor: Shivan inhabitants are hardened to fire, so their predators have developed alternative weaponry.

cards.name: Elite Archers
cards.text: {T}: Elite Archers deals 3 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
cards.originalText: {T}: Elite Archers deals 3 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
cards.flavor: Arrows fletched with the feathers of angels seldom miss their mark.

cards.name: Elvish Herder
cards.text: {G}: Target creature gains trample until end of turn.
cards.originalText: {G} Target creature gains trample until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Before Urza and Mishra came to Argoth, the herders prevented their creatures from stampeding. During the war, they encouraged it.

cards.name: Elvish Lyrist
cards.text: {G}, {T}, Sacrifice Elvish Lyrist: Destroy target enchantment.
cards.originalText: {G}, {T}, Sacrifice Elvish Lyrist: Destroy target enchantment.

cards.name: Enchantment Alteration
cards.text: Attach target Aura attached to a creature or land to another permanent of that type.
cards.originalText: Move target enchantment from one creature to another or from one land to another. (The enchantment's new target must be legal.)

rulings.text: If you change this card's target, you can change which Aura is targeted, but you can't choose where that Aura will be moved.
Only targets the Aura and not either of the things the Aura may be on.

cards.name: Endless Wurm
cards.text:
Trample

At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Endless Wurm unless you sacrifice an enchantment.
cards.originalText:
Trample

During your upkeep, sacrifice an enchantment or sacrifice Endless Wurm.
cards.flavor: Ages ago, a party of elves took cover to let one pass. They're still waiting.

rulings.text: You choose whether to sacrifice an enchantment or not on resolution. If not, then you sacrifice this card. You can choose to not sacrifice an enchantment if you no longer control this card on resolution.

cards.name: Endoskeleton
cards.text:
You may choose not to untap Endoskeleton during your untap step.

{2}, {T}: Target creature gets +0/+3 for as long as Endoskeleton remains tapped.
cards.originalText:
You may choose not to untap Endoskeleton during your untap phase.

{2}, {T}: Target creature gets +0/+3 as long as Endoskeleton remains tapped.

cards.name: Energy Field
cards.text:
Prevent all damage that would be dealt to you by sources you don't control.

When a card is put into your graveyard from anywhere, sacrifice Energy Field.
cards.originalText:
Prevent all damage dealt to you from sources you do not control. 

When a card is put into your graveyard, sacrifice Energy Field.

rulings.text: Buyback causes a spell to go to your hand instead of your graveyard, so using Buyback will avoid triggering this card to be sacrificed.
Discarding does trigger this.

cards.name: Exhaustion
cards.text: Creatures and lands target opponent controls don't untap during his or her next untap step.
cards.originalText: Creatures and lands target opponent controls do not untap during his or her next untap phase.
cards.flavor: The mage felt as though he'd been in the stasis suit for days. Upon his return, he found it was months.

rulings.text: The creatures and lands are only prevented from untapping during the targeted player's next untap step. They can still can untap during other player's untap steps.
No creatures or lands controlled by the player will untap during his or her next untap step. This includes those which entered the battlefield after Exhaustion resolved.

cards.name: Exhume
cards.text: Each player puts a creature card from his or her graveyard onto the battlefield.
cards.originalText: Each player chooses a creature card in his or her graveyard and puts that creature into play.
cards.flavor:
"Death—an outmoded concept. We sleep, and we change."

—Sitrik, birth priest

cards.name: Exploration
cards.text: You may play an additional land on each of your turns.
cards.originalText: You may play an additional land each turn.
cards.flavor: The first explorers found Argoth a storehouse of natural wealth—towering forests grown over rich veins of ore.

rulings.text: You have to say when you put the land out that it is the one you get because of Exploration. If you put out a Forest while Exploration is in on the battlefield, then Exploration leaves the battlefield (by being destroyed or something), you can't put out another Forest claiming that the first one was due to Exploration unless you said so when you played that Forest.

cards.name: Expunge
cards.text:
Destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.

Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
cards.originalText:
Destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. That creature cannot be regenerated this turn.

Cycling {2} (You may pay {2} and discard this card from your hand to draw a card. Play this ability as an instant.)

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

cards.name: Faith Healer
cards.text: Sacrifice an enchantment: You gain life equal to the sacrificed enchantment's converted mana cost.
cards.originalText: Sacrifice an enchantment: Gain life equal to the sacrificed enchantment's total casting cost.
cards.flavor: The power of faith is quiet. It is the leaf unmoved by the hurricane.

cards.name: Falter
cards.text: Creatures without flying can't block this turn.
cards.originalText: Creatures without flying cannot block this turn.
cards.flavor: Like a sleeping dragon, Shiv stirs and groans at times.

cards.name: Fault Line
cards.text: Fault Line deals X damage to each creature without flying and each player.
cards.originalText: Fault Line deals X damage to each creature without flying and each player.
cards.flavor:
We live on the serpent's back.

—Viashino saying

cards.name: Fecundity
cards.text: Whenever a creature dies, that creature's controller may draw a card.
cards.originalText: Whenever a creature is put into a graveyard from play, that creature's controller may draw a card.
cards.flavor: Life is eternal. A lifetime is ephemeral.

cards.name: Fertile Ground
cards.text:
Enchant land

Whenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, its controller adds one mana of any color to his or her mana pool (in addition to the mana the land produces).
cards.originalText: Whenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, it produces an additional one mana of any color.
cards.flavor: The forest was too lush for the brothers to despoil—almost.

rulings.text: The color of mana to be generated is chosen when tapping the land for mana.

printings: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition

cards.name: Fiery Mantle
cards.text:
Enchant creature

{R}: Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

When Fiery Mantle is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, return Fiery Mantle to its owner's hand.
cards.originalText:
When Fiery Mantle is put into a graveyard from play, return Fiery Mantle to owner's hand.

{R} Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Fire Ants
cards.text: {T}: Fire Ants deals 1 damage to each other creature without flying.
cards.originalText: {T}: Fire Ants deals 1 damage to each other creature without flying.
cards.flavor: Visitors to Shiv fear the dragons, the goblins, or the viashino. Natives fear the ants.

cards.name: Flesh Reaver
cards.text: Whenever Flesh Reaver deals damage to a creature or opponent, Flesh Reaver deals that much damage to you.
cards.originalText: Whenever Flesh Reaver successfully deals damage to a creature or opponent, Flesh Reaver deals an equal amount of damage to you.
cards.flavor: Though the reaver is horrifyingly effective, its dorsal vents spit a highly corrosive cloud of filth.

cards.name: Fluctuator
cards.text: Cycling abilities you activate cost you up to {2} less to activate.
cards.originalText: Cycling costs you up to {2} less to play.
cards.flavor: Fiko summoned only atogs for three straight sessions. The tutor couldn't decide whether to punish his failure or praise his consistency.

cards.name: Fog Bank
cards.text:
Defender, flying

Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by Fog Bank.
cards.originalText:
(Walls cannot attack.)

Flying

Fog Bank does not deal or receive combat damage.

rulings.text: If Fog Bank blocks a creature with trample, that creature's controller must assign 2 damage to Fog Bank (assuming it's blocking no other creatures, there was no damage marked on it, and nothing has changed its toughness). The remainder can be assigned to the defending player or planeswalker.

cards.originalText:

Sacrifice a forest: Regenerate enchanted creature.

cards.name: Gaea's Bounty
cards.text: Search your library for up to two Forest cards, reveal those cards, and put them into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
cards.originalText: Search your library for up to two forest cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your library afterward.
cards.flavor: The forest grew back so quickly that lumbering machines were suspended in the treetops.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.name: Gaea's Cradle
cards.text: {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool for each creature you control.
cards.originalText: {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool for each creature you control.
cards.flavor:
"Here sprouted the first seedling of Argoth. Here the last tree will fall."

—Gamelen, Citanul elder

cards.name: Gaea's Embrace
cards.text:
Enchant creature

Enchanted creature gets +3/+3 and has trample.

{G}: Regenerate enchanted creature.
cards.originalText:
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3 and gains trample.

{G} Regenerate enchanted creature.
cards.flavor: The forest rose to the battle, not to save the people but to save itself.

cards.name: Gamble
cards.text: Search your library for a card, put that card into your hand, discard a card at random, then shuffle your library.
cards.originalText: Search your library for a card, put that card into your hand, then discard a card at random. Shuffle your library afterward.
cards.flavor: When you've got nothing, you might as well trade it for something else.

rulings.text: You might end up discarding the card you searched for.

cards.name: Gilded Drake
cards.text:
Flying

When Gilded Drake enters the battlefield, exchange control of Gilded Drake and up to one target creature an opponent controls. If you don't make an exchange, sacrifice Gilded Drake. This ability can't be countered except by spells and abilities. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
cards.originalText:
Flying

When Gilded Drake comes into play, exchange control of Gilded Drake for target creature one of your opponents controls or sacrifice Gilded Drake.
cards.flavor: Buyer beware.

rulings.text: If the chosen creature to exchange is not on the battlefield at resolution, then sacrifice this card.

This ability is targeted, so Protection can prevent targeting if it exists when the ability would be put on the stack. Once the ability is on the stack, adding Protection will not counter the ability but the exchange will not take place since the target is illegal and you sacrifice this card on resolution.

cards.name: Glorious Anthem
cards.text: Creatures you control get +1/+1.
cards.originalText: All creatures you control get +1/+1.
cards.flavor: Once heard, the battle song of an angel becomes part of the listener forever.

cards.name: Goblin Cadets
cards.text: Whenever Goblin Cadets blocks or becomes blocked, target opponent gains control of it. (This removes Goblin Cadets from combat.)
cards.originalText: Whenever Goblin Cadets blocks or becomes blocked, target opponent gains control of it. (This removes Goblin Cadets from combat.)
cards.flavor: "If you kids don't stop that racket, I'm turning this expedition around right now"

foreignNames.name: ゴブリンの士官候補生

cards.name: Goblin Lackey
cards.text: Whenever Goblin Lackey deals damage to a player, you may put a Goblin permanent card from your hand onto the battlefield.
cards.originalText: Whenever Goblin Lackey successfully deals damage to a player, you may choose a Goblin card in your hand and put that Goblin into play.
cards.flavor: All bark, someone else's bite.

rulings.text: A Goblin permanent card is an artifact, creature, land, and/or enchantment card with the creature type "Goblin". Usually such cards will be creatures in addition to any other types, but they may be tribal instead. For example, you could put Boggart Shenanigans onto the battlefield with this effect.

cards.name: Goblin Matron
cards.text: When Goblin Matron enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a Goblin card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.
cards.originalText: When Goblin Matron comes into play, you may search your library for a Goblin card. If you do, reveal that card, put it into your hand, and shuffle your library afterward.
cards.flavor: There's always room for one more.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

You can search for any card with the creature type Goblin, including Creature or Tribal cards. Older cards of type "Summon Goblin" and "Summon Goblins" also count. You can't search for cards that have Goblin in the name but don't have the creature type Goblin.

cards.name: Goblin Offensive
cards.text: Put X 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens onto the battlefield.
cards.originalText: Put X Goblin tokens into play. Treat these tokens as 1/1 red creatures.
cards.flavor: They certainly are.

rulings.text: The tokens are named "Goblin" and are of creature type "Goblin".
X can be zero.

cards.name: Goblin Patrol
cards.text: Echo {R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
cards.originalText: Echo (During your next upkeep after this permanent comes under your control, pay its casting cost or sacrifice it.)
cards.flavor:
"Take the sharp metal stick and make a lotta holes."

—Jula, goblin raider

cards.name: Goblin Raider
cards.text: Goblin Raider can't block.
cards.originalText: Goblin Raider cannot block.
cards.flavor: He was proud to wear the lizard skin around his waist, just for the fun of annoying the enemy.

cards.name: Goblin Spelunkers
cards.text: Mountainwalk
cards.originalText: Mountainwalk (If defending player controls a mountain, this creature is unblockable.)
cards.flavor:
"It only short jump. You go first."

"AIIIEEEE"

"Hmm . . . we go different way now."

foreignNames.name: ゴブリンの洞窟探検家

cards.name: Goblin War Buggy
cards.text:
Haste

Echo {1}{R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
cards.originalText:
Echo (During your next upkeep after this permanent comes under your control, pay its casting cost or sacrifice it.)

Goblin War Buggy is unaffected by summoning sickness.

cards.name: Gorilla Warrior
cards.flavor: The gorilla beat its chest and threw great handfuls of leaves into the air. It howled challenge and showed its teeth. The mechanical soldier, not understanding, simply killed it.

cards.name: Grafted Skullcap
cards.text:
At the beginning of your draw step, draw an additional card.

At the beginning of your end step, discard your hand.
cards.originalText:
During your draw phase, draw an additional card.

At the end of each of your turns, discard your hand.
cards.flavor:
"Let go your mind. Mine is fitter."

—Gix, Yawgmoth praetor

cards.name: Great Whale
cards.text: When Great Whale enters the battlefield, untap up to seven lands.
cards.originalText: When Great Whale comes into play, untap up to seven lands.
cards.flavor:
"As a great whale dies, it flips onto its back. And so an island is born."

—Mariners' legend

rulings.text: You can untap another player's lands.
This does not target the lands.

cards.name: Greater Good
cards.text: Sacrifice a creature: Draw cards equal to the sacrificed creature's power, then discard three cards.
cards.originalText: Sacrifice a creature: Draw cards equal to the sacrificed creature's power, then choose and discard three cards.
cards.flavor:
"We have more sprouts than they have hands."

—Gamelen, Citanul elder

rulings.text: You must discard three cards regardless of how many cards you drew. If you have less than three cards in hand, you discard your hand.
You draw cards equal to the creature's power when you sacrificed it. This includes any bonuses from effects like Giant Growth.

cards.name: Greener Pastures
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, if that player controls more lands than each other player, the player puts a 1/1 green Saproling creature token onto the battlefield.
cards.originalText: During each player's upkeep, if that player controls more lands than any other, the player puts a Saproling token into play under his or her control. Treat this token as a 1/1 green creature.

rulings.text: The ability does not trigger unless the player has more lands at the beginning of upkeep. This is checked again on resolution, and if the player does not still have more lands, no token is generated.

cards.name: Guma
cards.text: Protection from blue
cards.originalText: Protection from blue
cards.flavor: When the giant returned for the night, he found a dead merfolk on his pillow. Although he praised the little guma, he inwardly wondered where she had hid the head.

cards.name: Hawkeater Moth
cards.text: Flying; shroud (This permanent can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
cards.originalText:
Flying

Hawkeater Moth cannot be the target of spells or abilities.
cards.flavor: Each day at dusk the birds above the canopy grow silent.

cards.name: Headlong Rush
cards.text: Attacking creatures gain first strike until end of turn.
cards.originalText: All attacking creatures gain first strike until end of turn.
cards.flavor: A landslide of goblins poured towards the defenders—tumbling, rolling, and bouncing their way down the steep hillside.

cards.name: Healing Salve
cards.text: Choose one — Target player gains 3 life; or prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
cards.originalText: Choose one Target player gains 3 life; or prevent up to 3 damage to a creature or player.
cards.flavor:
"Xantcha is recovering. The medicine is slow, but my magic would have killed her."

—Serra, to Urza

cards.name: Heat Ray
cards.text: Heat Ray deals X damage to target creature.
cards.originalText: Heat Ray deals X damage to target creature.
cards.flavor: It's not known whether the Thran built the device to forge their wonders or to defend them.

cards.name: Herald of Serra

cards.name: Lifeline
cards.text: Whenever a creature dies, if another creature is on the battlefield, return the first card to the battlefield under its owner's control at the beginning of the next end step.
cards.originalText: Whenever a creature is put into a graveyard and a creature is in play, return that creature from your graveyard to play at end of turn.

rulings.text: It fails to bring the creature back if the creature is not still in the graveyard at the end of turn.
It works for all players and has errata to remove the "your graveyard" text.
The creature comes back even if Lifeline leaves the battlefield after triggering, but before it resolves.
If multiple creatures are coming back, they come back one at a time, not all at once. This is because Lifeline triggered once for each creature and set up a separate "at end of turn" effect for each.

If more than one creature is on the battlefield and all the creatures on the battlefield go to the graveyard at once, then none of them are returned at end of turn. This is because Lifeline's ability has an intervening-if clause, which means that there must be at least one creature on the battlefield at the time the ability resolves.

rulings.text: Each activation is considered a new damage effect. An activation can only be 1 point of damage.
Note that "until end of turn" effects wear off after "at the beginning of the end step" triggered abilities, so an artifact that animates until end of turn can keep this on the battlefield.

It will stay on the battlefield if there is a creature that is put into the graveyard during the end step. This is because this ability will not trigger at all if there is at least one creature on the battlefield as the end step begins.

The card does go to the graveyard before it is exiled, so other triggered abilities will trigger on the card going to the graveyard.

It will not trigger on itself going to the graveyard, or on any other cards going to the graveyard at the same time. This means that neither itself nor other cards put into the graveyard at the same time as it will get exiled.

When this spell resolves, you either pay X mana or let your lands become tapped. The lands that become tapped are not "tapped for mana". If you choose to pay, you may pay the X mana using whatever mana abilities you want to use.

Only lands that actually have mana abilities will get tappped. This includes basic lands and lands with mana abilities printed on them, as well as lands which have been granted a mana ability by some effect.

rulings.text: Rewind targets only a spell. It doesn't target any lands. The lands are chosen on resolution. It doesn't matter who controls the lands.
When Rewind resolves, you choose up to four lands and those lands untap once. You can't choose one land and have it untap four times, for example.

If the spell is an illegal target when Rewind tries to resolve, perhaps because it was countered by another spell or ability, Rewind will be countered and none of its effects will happen. You won't untap any lands.
If Rewind resolves but the target spell can't be countered, you'll still untap lands.

cards.name: Sporogenesis

At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a fungus counter on target nontoken creature.

Whenever a creature with a fungus counter on it dies, put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token onto the battlefield for each fungus counter on that creature.

cards.originalText:
During your upkeep, you may put a fungus counter on target nontoken creature.

Whenever a creature with a fungus counter on it is put into a graveyard, put a Saproling token into play for each of those fungus counters. Treat these tokens as 1/1 green creatures.

When Sporogenesis leaves play, remove all fungus counters from all creatures.

rulings.text: If a non-creature with fungus counters on it leaves the battlefield, there is no effect.

If more than one Sporogenesis is on the battlefield and a creature with fungus counters on it leaves the battlefield, each Sporogenesis will put a Saproling onto the battlefield for each counter. In other words if there are N copies of Sporogenesis and the creature had M fungus counters, you get N * M Saprolings.
If one Sporogenesis leaves the battlefield, all fungus counters are removed even if other Sporogenesis cards are on the battlefield.
Adding a counter is optional. If you forget to add one during your upkeep, you cannot back up and add one later.

cards.name: Worship
cards.text: If you control a creature, damage that would reduce your life total to less than 1 reduces it to 1 instead.
cards.originalText: Damage that would reduce your life total to less than 1 instead reduces it to 1 if you control a creature.
cards.flavor:
"Believe in the ideal, not the idol."

—Serra

rulings.text: It reduces your life total to 1, not the damage to 1.

Worship does not prevent damage. It causes some damage to be unable to lower your life total. So any damage rendered useless by Worship was still dealt and is counted by effects that track the amount of damage done to a player. In addition, Worship does not prevent loss of life, so loss of life bypasses Worship.

cards.name: Yawgmoth's Edict
cards.text: Whenever an opponent casts a white spell, that player loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.
cards.originalText: Whenever one of your opponents successfully casts a white spell, that player loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor:
"Phyrexia's purity permits no other."

—Xantcha, Phyrexian outcast

cards.name: Yawgmoth's Will
cards.text:
Until end of turn, you may play cards from your graveyard.

If a card would be put into your graveyard from anywhere this turn, exile that card instead.
cards.originalText: Until end of turn, you may play cards in your graveyard as though they were in your hand. Cards put into your graveyard this turn are removed from the game instead.

rulings.text: The second ability creates a replacement effect. It applies to both costs and effects.
If you cast a Buyback spell, then there will be two effects trying to replace where the card goes. You get to choose if the Buyback returns the card to your hand or the card gets exiled.

If an effect asks you to discard a card, you can't "discard" something that is in your graveyard. Those cards are not in your hand. Thus, Cycling abilities of cards in the graveyard can't be activated.
It will exile itself since it goes to the graveyard after its effect starts.
If you play a card using Yawgmoth's Will and something triggers only when "cast from your hand", that something will not trigger. Such things trigger based on where the card came from.
To "play a card" is to either cast a spell or to put a land onto the battlefield using the main phase special action.
You cannot Suspend a card from your graveyard, only your hand.
